intro: Eschweilera fractiflexa, commonly known as the flexible eschweilera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myristicaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
